titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Robert F. Wheeler Papers, 1898-1977

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-15T12:36-0800

change.item: 19 November 2013: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated

did.unittitle: Robert F. Wheeler Papers
did.abstract: Writings, notes, statistics, printed matter, sound recordings, and copies of German government records, relating to the Unabhangige sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands and its relation with the Second and Third Internationals, and to socialist and labor movements in Germany, especially during World War I and the Weimar period. Includes microfilm of materials at various German archives

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Users must sign user agreement. Use copies of all sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert F. Wheeler Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

note.p: Note. It appears that it was the researcher's intention to view this material as part of the previous complex of documents (Auftrag 66/01537/3 and 4). There is a notation on the original metal container of this reel to the effect that Auftrag 02369 was "what was missing," and it was originally spliced in with reel VI.

note.p: Note. This reel ends with a frame marking the start of a new Auftragsnummer: 67/9/2943. There is also a clearly recognizable splice in this reel, 68 frames before the end, i.e. counted back from the Auftragsnummer at the end of the reel.x Most likely Auftragsnummer 67/9/2943 marks the start of these 68 frames, and was spliced in by researcher to form a continuous body of information.

Institut fur Marxismus Leninismus beim Zentralkomittee der SED. Berlin Auftrag 4681 B4. Zweck: Dissertat. Allenstein
Vollzugsausschuss to Reichsregierung Ebert.
Idem of to Scheidemann. Mentions success in preventing a publication by a Doebbeke on local paper. Copy of same (seized) included. (concerns the repression of left dissent.)
Arbeiterrat des Amtsbezirks Ammendorf to Reichsregierung. Defends seizure of food supplies at a factory.
Arbeiter u. S.rat Brausnberg to Reichsregierung of Complains that local paper will not accppt ads from socialists to announce their various meetings etc.

Volksrat Kempen i. P. Letter to hohe Reichsregierung, complaining about the fact that troops have entered the town and caused a disturbance of the Ruhe by their presence. The general in question said that he had been sent by the Reichsregierung. Asks for clarification.

Various other communications between local AuSrate and the Reichs-government about all sorts of problems involving jurisdiction, sovereignty etc. All from the period of the Revolution. Also showing activities of the military in Prussian (eastern) provinces re-establishing "order."
Rest of reel not further explored in detail. Appears to be entirely on same topic, from the various regional AuSrate (also from the West). Many Telegrams.
Researcher's original notation on reel box: Ledebour on origins of Revol.; Daumig on 21 July demonstrations; Telegrams from Sold-atenrate; Resolution of by LeipzigAuSrat.
Staatsarchiv Dresden. (Feed in from the right). Aufgragsnummer A.652.66
Ausweisungen. Allgemeines. Min. des. Innern IIA. Bd. 3.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (e.g., first entry: Reichsministerium des Innem to die Regierungen der Gliedstaaten and for Prussia an das Min. d. Innern. Warns against the presence of many (21.2.19) Russian, Boschewist agents, whose activities must be combatted as strenuously as possible.)

Protokoll uber die Verhandlungen der ausserordentlichen
Landesversammlung der USP Sachsens. Abgehalten am 1. u. im Volkshaus zu Leipzig. Seite 7-16, 19-20, 43-44, 128-135.

etc. etc. Date of this letter: Order then follows.
Further miscellaneous printed material filmed at or ordered at Museum fur Geschichte der Stadt Leipzig. Abt. Arbeiterbewegung. 701 Leipzig. Georgi-Dimitroff-Platz 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains among other thins: Programmentwurf von Conrad Doebbeke zu einem Programm der USP. 5 frames. (typed). Further statistical material. A typed fragment starting on a p. 54 with the following subheading: Die revolutioaren Potenzen des Januarstreiks 1918 und die Ursachen fur seine geringe Resonanz Resonanz in Leipzig. (19 frames.). Final document: Streng Vertraulich! An die Parteifunktionare! Internal printed document concering the conflict between USPD, KPD, and SD. from 1919/1920. Leipzig. Genosse Geyer. End of reel.
